pullRequest.title: Patch EarlyProgressVisualization on mac
pullRequest.bodyText:
Moves GLFW commands to correct thread for MacOS.
glfwPollEvents cannot be called from the secondary thread on MacOS, so its not called at all after window creation. While this not preferable the window will be marked as not responding, but there is no prompt and swapping buffers still updates what is shown.
Unchanged behavior on Linux and Windows, still uses secondary thread for glfw including event polling

nodes.bodyText:
This still needs the disable flag, because there is some edgecases like macs in this case that have issues. So there needs to be a way to work around it.
Plus the entire point of this being off thread is to not block vanilla loading... Having the GL context be created in the main thread has no side effects to Minecraft crating its own GL context in the same thread?
